message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.OS, cs.AR, cs.SY

This paper discusses the integration of persistent memory into in-memory key-value stores and databases, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) and Database (cs.DB) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the design tradeoffs between throughput, latency, and recovery time, which are relevant to Operating Systems (cs.OS) and Architecture (cs.AR) sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes design principles that hold across different implementations, which is relevant to Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
